title: Mystery 'Robin Hood' handing out free cash and leaving £20 notes on lamp posts
text:

A self-styled 'Robin Hood' is handing out free cash and leaving £20 notes stuck to lamp posts in a city centre.

The mystery artist - who identifies himself as Robin Loxley - has been giving away hundreds of pounds on the streets of Sheffield - the birthplace of heroic outlaw Robin Hood.

He estimates he has dished out £500 so far and is urging people to "keep your eyes peeled" for the chance to get some of his cash.

He is also planning on heading to Manchester, Leeds, Liverpool, York, Newcastle, Bristol, Edinburgh and London as part of the art instillation stunt.

(Image: outlaw_robinloxley/Instagram)

(Image: outlaw_robinloxley/Instagram)

On his website he states: "I AM Robin Loxley the artist. Creating Street art high profile art installations in locations around England for now. Without prior Knowledge or permission."

He has also been documenting his stunts on Instagram where he posts videos of the cash he has stuck to lamp posts.

Robin contacted The Star in Sheffield to reveal his motivation for his generosity.

(Image: outlaw_robinloxley/Instagram)

(Image: outlaw_robinloxley/Instagram)

He told the publication: "People will interpret it in different ways - that is the beauty of art. Some might say I am trying to start a buzz, others might say I am just being generous.

"If people are inspired to be more generous by what I have been doing then that is a good thing. One person I gave money to gave some of it to a homeless person so two people benefited.

"My slogan is 'Robin Loxley is coming' and people can expect a lot more."

(Image: outlaw_robinloxley/Instagram)

Robin also recently broke into an empty shop and left a large sign in the window which read 'Another blank canvas.'

He insisted he had not committed any criminal offence and did not steal anything.

He said it was to draw attention to what he says is the decline of the city's high street shops which are struggling to compete with internet giants.
description: The artist - who identifies himself as Robin Loxley - said he is "trying to start a buzz" as well as be generous
